bugs.title: [Regression] ACPI Error: Result stack is empty!

bugzilla.short_desc: [Regression] ACPI Error: Result stack is empty!

long_desc.thetext:
Created attachment 1471643
Full dmesg in 4.17.11

Description of problem:
With kernel-4.17.11 I get a slew of ACPI errors at boot that weren't there in 4.17.10:

[    0.028419] ACPI Error: Result stack is empty! State=00000000f95979a7 (20180313/dswstate-65)
[    0.028430] ACPI Error: AE_AML_NO_RETURN_VALUE, Missing or null operand (20180313/dsutils-612)
[    0.028436] ACPI Error: AE_AML_NO_RETURN_VALUE, While creating Arg 0 (20180313/dsutils-727)
[    0.028491] ACPI Error: Result stack is empty! State=00000000f95979a7 (20180313/dswstate-65)
[    0.028497] ACPI Error: AE_AML_NO_RETURN_VALUE, Missing or null operand (20180313/dsutils-612)
[    0.028501] ACPI Error: AE_AML_NO_RETURN_VALUE, While creating Arg 0 (20180313/dsutils-727)
[    0.028508] ACPI Error: Result stack is empty! State=00000000f95979a7 (20180313/dswstate-65)
[    0.028513] ACPI Error: AE_AML_NO_RETURN_VALUE, Missing or null operand (20180313/dsutils-612)
[    0.028517] ACPI Error: AE_AML_NO_RETURN_VALUE, While creating Arg 0 (20180313/dsutils-727)
[    0.028653] ACPI Error: Result stack is empty! State=00000000f95979a7 (20180313/dswstate-65)
[    0.028658] ACPI Error: AE_AML_NO_RETURN_VALUE, Missing or null operand (20180313/dsutils-612)
[    0.028662] ACPI Error: AE_AML_NO_RETURN_VALUE, While creating Arg 0 (20180313/dsutils-727)
[    0.029103] ACPI Error: Result stack is empty! State=00000000f95979a7 (20180313/dswstate-65)
[    0.029109] ACPI Error: AE_AML_NO_RETURN_VALUE, Missing or null operand (20180313/dsutils-612)
[    0.029114] ACPI Error: AE_AML_NO_RETURN_VALUE, While creating Arg 0 (20180313/dsutils-727)
[    0.029276] ACPI Error: Result stack is empty! State=00000000f95979a7 (20180313/dswstate-65)
[    0.029282] ACPI Error: AE_AML_NO_RETURN_VALUE, Missing or null operand (20180313/dsutils-612)
[    0.029287] ACPI Error: AE_AML_NO_RETURN_VALUE, While creating Arg 0 (20180313/dsutils-727)
[    0.029924] ACPI Error: Result stack is empty! State=00000000f95979a7 (20180313/dswstate-65)
[    0.029930] ACPI Error: AE_AML_NO_RETURN_VALUE, Missing or null operand (20180313/dsutils-612)
[    0.029935] ACPI Error: AE_AML_NO_RETURN_VALUE, While creating Arg 0 (20180313/dsutils-727)
[    0.029941] ACPI Error: Result stack is empty! State=00000000f95979a7 (20180313/dswstate-65)
[    0.029947] ACPI Error: AE_AML_NO_RETURN_VALUE, Missing or null operand (20180313/dsutils-612)
[    0.029952] ACPI Error: AE_AML_NO_RETURN_VALUE, While creating Arg 0 (20180313/dsutils-727)
[    0.031717] ACPI Error: Result stack is empty! State=00000000f95979a7 (20180313/dswstate-65)
[    0.031725] ACPI Error: AE_AML_NO_RETURN_VALUE, Missing or null operand (20180313/dsutils-612)
[    0.031730] ACPI Error: AE_AML_NO_RETURN_VALUE, While creating Arg 0 (20180313/dsutils-727)
[    0.031738] ACPI Error: Result stack is empty! State=00000000f95979a7 (20180313/dswstate-65)
[    0.031743] ACPI Error: AE_AML_NO_RETURN_VALUE, Missing or null operand (20180313/dsutils-612)
[    0.031748] ACPI Error: AE_AML_NO_RETURN_VALUE, While creating Arg 0 (20180313/dsutils-727)

Full dmesg attached.
Seems it's known and patched - https://lkml.org/lkml/2018/7/28/151

Fix went in 4.17.12-stable which should be out soon
https://lkml.org/lkml/2018/8/1/811
kernel-headers-4.17.12-1.fc28 kernel-tools-4.17.12-200.fc28 kernel-4.17.12-200.fc28 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 28. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2018-ca0e10fc6e
kernel-headers-4.17.12-1.fc27 kernel-tools-4.17.12-100.fc27 kernel-4.17.12-100.fc27 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 27. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2018-2f6df9abfb

(In reply to Ozkan Sezer from comment #2)
> Fix went in 4.17.12-stable which should be out soon
> https://lkml.org/lkml/2018/8/1/811

Ok. These messages are gone with this update.

kernel-4.17.12-100.fc27, kernel-headers-4.17.12-1.fc27, kernel-tools-4.17.12-100.fc27 has been pushed to the Fedora 27 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2018-ca0e10fc6e
Still present in .12. I can confirm that rolling back to .9 fixes it.

(In reply to HaskellCurry from comment #8)
> Still present in .12. I can confirm that rolling back to .9 fixes it.


Apologies, seems to be fixed.

kernel-4.17.12-200.fc28, kernel-headers-4.17.12-1.fc28, kernel-tools-4.17.12-200.fc28 has been pushed to the Fedora 28 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

kernel-4.17.12-100.fc27, kernel-headers-4.17.12-1.fc27, kernel-tools-4.17.12-100.fc27 has been pushed to the Fedora 27 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

bugs.title: CVE-2018-14734 kernel: use-after-free in ucma_leave_multicast in drivers/infiniband/core/ucma.c

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2018-14734 kernel: use-after-free in ucma_leave_multicast in drivers/infiniband/core/ucma.c

long_desc.thetext:
A flaw was found in Linux Kernel in the ucma_leave_multicast() function in drivers/infiniband/core/ucma.c which allows to access a certain data structure after freeing it in ucma_process_join(). This allows an attacker to cause use-after-free bug and to induce kernel memory corruption, leading to a system crash or other unspecified impact.

References:

https://marc.info/?t=152787806300002&r=1&w=2

https://patchwork.kernel.org/patch/10444267/

An upstream patch:

https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=cb2595c1393b4a5211534e6f0a0fbad369e21ad8

Created kernel tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1611007]

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7

Via RHSA-2019:0831 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2019:0831

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7

Via RHSA-2019:2029 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2019:2029

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7

Via RHSA-2019:2043 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2019:2043

A flaw was found in Linux Kernel in the ucma_leave_multicast() function in drivers/infiniband/core/ucma.c which allows to access a certain data structure after freeing it in ucma_process_join(). This allows an attacker to cause use-after-free bug and to induce kernel memory corruption, leading to a system crash or other unspecified impact.

References:

https://marc.info/?t=152787806300002&r=1&w=2

https://patchwork.kernel.org/patch/10444267/

An upstream patch:

https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=cb2595c1393b4a5211534e6f0a0fbad369e21ad8

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of fedora-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Reproducers, if any, will remain confidential and never be made public, unless done so by the security team.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=1611005,1611007

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new

comments.text: This update has been submitted for testing by jforbes.
works well (incl. nvidia driver from rpmfusion)

System boot ok, no problems so far.
ACPI Errors [#1609932] are gone.

Kernel test fails on ./default/cachedrop
TestError: Can't free dentries and inodes

> Kernel test fails on ./default/cachedrop TestError: Can't free dentries and inodes

That sounds scary..??
This update has been pushed to testing.
works for me

Works for me.. The Default and Performance Regression tests pass OK.  
AMD 965, x86_64 work station, Plasma DE, X-server, nVidia card GTX 650 (GK107) + nVidia RPM's from Negativo17.
I did test with Nouveau after seeing all the commits, but after an hour or so I had the usual hard lockup.
Works here (T450s, XS35GTv2, VM).
Regression tests seem to be okay and system works just fine
works fine
works for me on a T450s

This i686 kernel version functions normally. The default regression tests passed or were skipped.

karma: +1
Works great on Lenovo T480 with dGPU!  LGTM!  =)
Looks good, system works fine, and kernel regression tests pass.
Works

Essentially same issues as with the 4.17.6 update, filed in BZ:

* https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2018-c03ba71e1d
* https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1612773

Lenovo Thinkpad P50, nouveau driver, using external dock: Doesn't recognize/use my second display, lots of flickering when booting.

Looks good on VM here. 4.17.13 was just released ;)

karma: +1
works for me on T460s

WFM on abt. 40 different machines, w/ RPMfusion's Nvidia stuff.  Seems to fix the NFS misery
of previous 4.17's.
No regressions spotted.
no regressions noted
ltm, pass default test
Works on Thinkpad T440s. Kernel regression test passed.
